pli-tv-bi-vb-ss2:1.11: _Jānāhi_, literally, “You know.” The implied meaning is not clear. However, in commenting on a different passage, one of the sub-commentaries, Sp-ṭ 4.330, defines the word as follows: _Jānāhīti cettha paṭipajjāti attho veditabbo_, “And here the meaning of ‘you know’ is to be understood as ‘you undertake’.”
pli-tv-bi-vb-ss2:2.1.30: The Pali just says _dukkaṭa_, without specifying that it is an _āpatti_, “an offense”. Yet elsewhere, such as at [pli-tv-bu-vb-ss10:2.65](), the _dukkaṭa_ is annulled if you commit the full offense of _saṅghādisesa_. The implication is that in these contexts _dukkaṭa_ should be read as _āpatti dukkaṭassa_, “an offense of wrong conduct”.
